div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2092 Selinunte ("Latomie"), 1885 (949) Burial: c. 409 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 48 AR Rhegium: 1 tetradr. (oecist) Catana: 3 tetradr. (slow quadr.) Gela: 7 tetradr. (to Jenkins 478) Himera: 1 tetradr. Leontini: 4 tetradr. Messana: 3 tetradr. Segesta: 1 tetradr. Selinus: 3 tetradr. Syracuse: 21 tetradr. (to Tudeer 54) Athens: 4 tetradr. Disposition: Palermo but 5 coins (Catana 3, Himera, Rhegium) were subsequently replaced by Pegasi (AIIN 1956, p. 206) â€ Salinas: NSc 1885, pp. 503-5 Tusa Cutroni, AIIN 1956, p. 206 Jenkins, Gela, p. 158
